title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SACRAMENTO — The roar inside ARCO Arena was not merely for a victory, but for a piece of basketball history delivered by one man. Mitch Richmond didn’t just beat the Vancouver Grizzlies; he eviscerated them, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record **47 points** to power the Sacramento Kings to a commanding 109-93 win.

From the opening tip, Richmond was a man possessed. His 47-point eruption was a masterclass in offensive efficiency, a blistering performance that left the Grizzlies scrambling for answers that simply did not exist. Every pull-up jumper, every drive to the rack, and every clutch three-pointer carved his name deeper into the Kings' record books. The Vancouver defense, helpless against the onslaught, could only watch as Richmond turned the contest into his personal showcase.

While Richmond was the undisputed main event, he received crucial support. Olden Polynice dominated the glass, hauling in **19 rebounds** to control the paint and ignite the Sacramento fast break. Point guard Bobby Hurley orchestrated the affair with precision, dishing out **13 assists** to keep the offense humming.

The Grizzlies, overmatched by the historic individual effort, were led by Blue Edwards’ 21 points and Sam Mack’s 16, but their contributions were mere footnotes on Richmond’s legendary night.

This was more than a game; it was the Mitch Richmond Game. A night where one player’s transcendent talent overwhelmed an entire opponent and gifted a franchise and its fans a memory that would echo for generations. The final score was 109-93, but the story, forever, will be the 47.
